item.title: 香港房价下跌抵消物业税减免后的涨幅
item.description: 香港二手住宅价格连续第四周下跌，跌至两个多月来的最低点，抹去了政府二月份取消房地产限购后的涨幅。【原文：Hong Kong’s secondhand residential prices fell for the fourth week to the lowest in more than two months, erasing the gains in values after the government removed property curbs in February.】

item.title: 世界银行称战争严重打击了巴勒斯坦经济
item.description: 据世界银行估计，加沙战争使巴勒斯坦经济遭受了 "沉重打击"，在经济增长恶化和就业岗位严重流失的同时，资金缺口也在不断扩大。【原文：The Palestinian economy is suffering a “severe blow” as a result of the war in Gaza, facing a widening financing gap alongside deteriorating growth and dire job losses, according to estimates by the World Bank.】

item.title: 被监禁的俄罗斯大亨赢得英国裁决，阻止 75 亿美元赔付
item.description: 一名被监禁的俄罗斯富豪赢得了英国法院的一项裁决，该裁决阻止了一家受制裁的俄罗斯实体在与控制黑海一个具有重要战略意义的港口有关的诉讼中获得 75 亿美元。【原文：A jailed Russian tycoon won a UK court ruling blocking a sanctioned Russian entity from getting $7.5 billion in a suit linked to control of a strategically crucial port in the Black Sea.】

item.title: 所谓 2024 年最容易的债券交易仍未奏效
item.description: 欢迎收看供需完全平衡的《每周固定》（Weekly Fix）时事通讯。我是跨资产记者凯蒂-格雷菲尔德（Katie Greifeld）。【原文：Welcome to the Weekly Fix, the newsletter where supply and demand is perfectly balanced. I’m cross-asset reporter Katie Greifeld.】

item.title: 约旦表示，瑞士央行不必在透明度问题上追随同行
item.description: 瑞士国家银行行长托马斯-乔丹（Thomas Jordan）认为，瑞士国家银行应坚持不公布决策者讨论记录的做法。【原文：The Swiss National Bank should stick with its approach of not publishing minutes of policymakers’ discussions, according to President Thomas Jordan.】

item.title: 法国呼吁七国集团共同评估中国产能过剩问题
item.description: 法国财政部长布鲁诺-勒梅尔（Bruno Le Maire）表示，七国集团需要对中国过剩的工业出口以及各国可用于解决这一问题的工具进行公平而深入的评估。【原文：French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said the Group of Seven needs to establish a fair and in-depth assessment of excess Chinese industrial exports and the tools countries can use to address it.】

item.title: 伦敦交易所在加密货币发行前失去半数 ETF 团队成员
item.description: 伦敦证券交易所集团公司（London Stock Exchange Group Plc）负责监管交易所交易基金的四人团队失去了一半成员，而此时该公司正准备上市首批与加密货币相关的产品。【原文：London Stock Exchange Group Plc has lost half of its four-person team overseeing exchange-traded funds, just as it prepares to list its first products tied to cryptocurrencies.】

item.title: 股票交易员为英国脱欧以来的最大动荡准备游戏计划
item.description: 英国大选早于预期，促使交易员为英国脱欧以来最大的政治动荡做好准备，尽管自宣布大选以来市场反应大多平淡。【原文：The earlier-than-expected UK election is prompting traders to prepare for the country’s biggest political shakeup since Brexit, despite the mostly muted market reaction since the announcement was made.】

item.title: 美国银行哈特内特称股市反弹正接近卖出信号
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）策略师迈克尔-哈特内特（Michael Hartnett）认为，全球股市的涨势有可能过热。【原文：The rally in global equity markets is at risk of overheating, according to Bank of America Corp. strategist Michael Hartnett.】

item.title: 印度卢比因股市和印度央行红利创 5 个月最大涨幅
item.description: 印度卢比创下五个月来最大升幅，该国主要股票指数创下历史新高，政府派发的股息也超过预期。【原文：The Indian rupee strengthened by the most in five months, as the country’s key equities gauges hit a record high and amid a larger-than-expected dividend payout to the government.】

item.title: 哈格里夫斯-兰斯当联合创始人称收购 "唤醒 "了股价
item.description: Hargreaves Lansdown Plc 的亿万富翁创始人之一表示，一群私募股权买家的收购要约正在重振该公司股价多年来的跌势。【原文：One of Hargreaves Lansdown Plc’s billionaire founders says the takeover bid by a group of private equity buyers is reinvigorating the company’s share price after years of downward drift.】

item.title: 芬兰总理称俄罗斯边境计划 "可能是在考验我们
item.description: 芬兰总理佩特里-奥尔波（Petteri Orpo）说，俄罗斯最近采取的与划界有关的行动 "可能是在考验 "其西部边境的北约成员国。【原文：Russia “may be testing” the NATO member countries on its western frontier with recent actions linked to demarcating its borders, Finnish Prime Minister Petteri Orpo said.】

item.title: 反以色列抵制损害麦当劳和肯德基在亚洲和中东的业务
item.description: 包括麦当劳和肯德基在内的美国快餐品牌在亚洲、中东和欧洲部分地区面临着严峻的经营环境，由于在加沙冲突中被认为与以色列有联系，抵制这些品牌的呼声很高。【原文：US fast food brands, including McDonald’s and KFC, are facing a challenging operating environment in Asia, the Middle East and some parts of Europe weighed by calls to boycott their brands due to perceived links to Israel amid the conflict in Gaza.】

item.title: 与卢克-卡瓦（Luke Kawa）在 "记忆牲畜狂热 2.0 "节目中探讨更多内容
item.description:
为什么这不是 2021 年的重演？【原文：

Why this wasn't 2021 all over again.

】

item.title: 西蒙-赛德勒的 Segantii 基金的兴衰，亚洲最成功的对冲基金之一
item.description:
一项刑事指控导致一家拥有 16 年历史的基金停业，其回报率长期以来一直为业界所羡慕

。【原文：

A criminal charge triggers the shutting of a 16-year-old fund with returns long envied by industry

】

item.title: 欧佩克+将于下月在网上而非维也纳举行会议
item.description: 欧佩克+"将于下月召开会议，在线讨论石油生产问题，而非原定的当面讨论。【原文：OPEC+ will hold next month’s meeting to discuss oil production online rather than in person as originally scheduled.】

item.title: 丹斯克称欧洲央行在 6 月降息后不会在 9 月降息
item.description: 丹斯克银行（Danske Bank）不再预测欧洲央行将在 9 月份降低利率，理由是通胀形势严峻以及欧元区经济在 2024 年开局强劲。【原文：Danske Bank no longer predicts the European Central Bank will lower interest rates in September, citing sticky inflation and the strong start to 2024 by the euro-zone economy.】

item.title: 习近平召开深化改革会议后中国电力股上涨
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平在 7 月召开的一次重要党内会议之前，呼吁深化能源行业和其他行业的改革，此后中国电力生产商的股价有所上涨。【原文：Shares of Chinese power producers gained after President Xi Jinping called for deeper reforms in the energy sector and other industries ahead of a key party meeting in July.】

item.title: 斯蒂芬-伯德卸任 Abrdn 首席执行官，首席财务官上任
item.description: 陷入困境的资产管理公司 Abrdn Plc 首席执行官斯蒂芬-伯德（Stephen Bird）已经卸任。【原文：Stephen Bird, the chief executive of trouble asset manager Abrdn Plc, has stepped down.】

item.title: 德国建筑业点燃复苏之火 消费者即将加入
item.description: 年初，建筑业和贸易业阻止了德国经济的衰退，开启了最终应由消费者主导的经济复苏。【原文：Construction and trade prevented a recession in Germany at the start of the year, setting off a recovery that should eventually be led by consumers.】

item.title: 英国雨季零售额降幅超预期
item.description: 由于阴雨天气和不确定的经济形势导致消费者推迟消费，英国零售销售额以今年最快的速度下滑，这也是保守党政府竞选连任所面临的障碍。【原文：UK retail sales fell at the fastest pace this year as consumers delayed spending due to rainy weather and uncertain economic conditions, underlying the hurdles facing the Conservative government’s bid for reelection.】

item.title: 大选前夕，英国 7 月能源账单将下降 7
item.description: 英国家庭能源账单将于 7 月下降，同一周，英国还将举行投票选举，届时生活成本将成为一个关键问题。【原文：UK household energy bills will drop in July, the same week the country goes to the polls in an election where cost of living is a key issue.】

item.title: 英国投票否决了对 6 月降息的持币观望，英镑获得提振
item.description: 本周，英国央行下月降息对交易商来说几乎是不可想象的，这再次推动了英镑的反弹。【原文：The pound’s peer-beating rally received another boost this week as an interest-rate cut by the Bank of England next month became virtually unthinkable to traders.】

item.title: 农作物指数收复 2024 年失地，重燃食品通胀担忧
item.description: 从小麦到咖啡，恶劣的天气加剧了人们对收成的担忧，重新引发了对食品价格上涨的担忧。【原文：An index of major crops has wiped out its 2024 loss as bad weather stokes worries about harvests from wheat to coffee, reviving concerns about rising food prices.】

item.title: 英国电网大手笔出让水权，显示行业对濒临枯竭的水资源的呼吁
item.description: 英国国家电网公司（National Grid Plc）首席执行官表示，该公司的巨额集资是欧洲 15 年来银行业以外最大的配股融资。这与英国陷入困境的自来水公司所采取的融资方式形成了鲜明对比。【原文：The enormous capital raise by the UK’s National Grid Plc is Europe’s largest rights offering outside the banking sector for 15 years, according to its chief executive officer. And it’s in stark contrast to the funding approach taken by Britain’s struggling water companies.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国市场现在的动向
印度指数合格债券将创一年来最佳表现
item.description: 在新的外资流入和创纪录的央行派息的帮助下，有资格被纳入摩根大通公司指数的印度政府债券有望实现近一年来最好的月度回报。【原文：The Indian government bonds eligible for inclusion in the JPMorgan Chase & Co. index look poised to deliver their best monthly returns in nearly a year, helped by fresh foreign inflows and a record central bank payout.】

item.title: 建筑商万科将部分私人债务证券化以延迟还款
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，中国万科集团公司已将保险公司持有的部分非公开发行债务转换为资产支持证券，该公司正努力进一步推迟已经推迟的付款。【原文：China Vanke Co. has swapped some of its privately issued debt held by insurers into asset-backed securities, as the builder works to further push back already deferred payments, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 对日本央行加息的押注引发 2019 年以来最大规模的日元债券市场抢购潮
item.description: 本月迄今为止，海外发行商以五年来最快的速度抛售日元债券，在日本央行加息预期推高借贷成本之前追逐廉价资金。【原文：Overseas issuers sold yen bonds at the fastest pace in five years so far this month, chasing cheap funds before an expected interest rate hike by the Bank of Japan pushes up borrowing costs.】
